mission.name: 1. Spirefall
mission.desc: Raider infantry lay siege to the Spire in advance of Typhon Vex's forward vanguard.

speech.line: Raiders are attacking the Spire! Commander, maneuver your men into position and destroy them.

mission.name: 2. Cannon Fire
mission.desc: The Raider siege continues. Katana and the Imperial forces push ahead in defense.

speech.line: Your time is over, Halcyon! Our shells will punch through your armor. I will be triumphant!
We've mobilized medics to take care of the wounded. Drive the Raiders from Ashrock!
You will not get rid of us so easily, old man. My men are inspired by carnage!
My missiles will rain from the sky and strike you down! There is nowhere to hide!
Typhon Vex has retreated! We must find the vermin. Destroy all Raider bases in sight.

splash.text: The siege was won, and the Asphodelians were banished. Thirty years pass...

speech.line: Raider siege tanks have been sighted! Destroy them!
Where is that rat, Typhon, hiding?! We must reach Relay Station X-8. It will allow us to track him.
A whole nest of Raiders sits at the base of the Relay Station. Cut them down!
General Halcyon! Sir! My unit and I were posted in this station and tried to stand against the Raiders, but there were too many. I'm all that is left.
Then fall in line, soldier. You'll be helping us hunt Typhon Vex.
We've managed to trace Typhon's path. He is headed toward Baron's Claw Labs.
We must prevent him from reaching the labs.
What could Typhon want with abandoned labs?
Baron's Claw is not abandoned. It contains...something that cannot fall into Vex's hands.
Damn! They've entrenched themselves outside the base. We'll have to blast our way through!
Halcyon! You managed to drag your old bones all the way out here? It is all for naught. You will die now.
We've entered the labs!
It is too late! Typhon Vex is cutting into the vaults below to obtain the Prometheus Device.
What is that noise? It sounds like screaming.
Hurry! We need to get to the vaults!
What is down there? What is the Prometheus Device?
Yes the Prometheus Device is mine! Malika, keep this old fool busy!
Gladly.
Vex, the fool. He released a powerful Bloodthirsty into the ranks of his own men to keep us distracted. The Broodmother will shred both our ranks.
The Broodmother? One of the oldest Bloodthirsty? I thought she was killed during the battle of Cleave Rock.
No. We had her captured. We had hoped to use her to build a weapon against the Bloodthirsty.
These Bloodthirsty are being stirred by the Broodmother.
It looks like they are being led by Raiders...but something is off.
They are corrupted by the Broodmother's influence.
What is the Prometheus Device exactly?
Originally it was our weapon against the Bloodthirsty, but it didn't work. It only made them more powerful.
I assume Typhon plans to use it to activate the Nexus in the Wasteland. He wants the full destruction of Acheron.
More heretics! Burn them away!
Righteous? They've never been seen this far from their Council. They must have been alerted to the Broodmother's presence.
The Righteous are the ancient enemy of the Bloodthirsty.
They must have thought that we were infected.
How does bringing the Prometheus Device to the Nexus threaten Acheron?
It will act as a key, releasing the stored energy in the Nexus. That power will wash over Acheron turning all living things to ash.
The Bloodthirsty are swarming all over the place!
We must be close to the Broodmother.
More Righteous!
You're the reason this bane has been unleashed! Die!
The Broodmother! Aim everything we have on her!
She is dead, but the damage is done. Bloodthirsty across Acheron have been stirred.
Commander Halcyon! It's good to see you, We've recently come under siege by the Xeno.
The Xeno haven't been seen in twenty years!
We picked up strange subspace signals right before the Xeno began attacking.
And they've been falling from the skies since?
Yes, sir.
Tracking drones indicate Typhon is growing closer to the Nexus, but the energy the Device is giving off is scrambling our sensors.
The Prometheus Device is resonating with the Nexus.
How long have the Xeno been attacking?
They started their assault a few days ago.
The resonance of the Prometheus Device and the Nexus must have awakened the Xeno from their cryo-sleep.
What in the seven hells is that?!
A Xeno dropship! Take cover!
More Xeno ships are entering the atmosphere!
The Xeno are retreating!
No. They are heading to the Nexus as well...
Full advance!
Don't touch any Xeno weapons or armor. Most are rigged to explode!
The Xeno are engaging the Raiders!
Typhon Vex is just ahead! We just need to cut through this unit of Xenos!
Try as you might, Halcyon, you and this world will burn!
I will see you dead this day, Typhon!
Your threats mean nothing, old man.
The Nexus shall ignite Acheron! We are nothing before its might!
I have fought too long to see everything taken away. This ends now.
Typhon no doubt retreated back to his homeland of Kor.
We managed to stop him from reaching the Nexus in the Wasteland. He may try and unlock the Blightlands Nexus.
How dare you set foot on Kor soil, Imperial scum.
Make these butchers pay!
Head for the base and secure it. Make sure no one escapes.
Sir, there are civilians here.
That was a direct order.
Protect the city. We need to stand against this monster!
Good work, now execute the prisoners.
That's mad Sir, they're no threat. I refuse to carry out such a barbaric order.
If you're not with me, you're against me!
Free the prisoners.
I will not stand this indignity. You will be punished for your treason!
We're pinned down.
You traitors will get what you deserve; a shallow grave in Raider territory.
Raiders, support the commander fighting Halcyon.
Your fate is sealed now!
Halcyon is retreating in to the Sulfuris Pits. Never thought I would have my life saved by a Raider!
My life was in your debt. I repay my debts.
What's the matter Yurich? Couldn't finish the job? You'll burn for your incompetance!
I never agreed with Typhon. His bid at outstanding power seemed to overshadow his role as leader.
And now he threatens the entirety of Acheron.
Righteous have halted our previous advances into the Blightlands. Typhon might have slipped through but we must fight.
We'd heard reports about how he'd unleashed the Broodmother. The beast killed Raider and Imperial alike.
He plans on opening the Nexus and washing Acheron in the Blight.
That would destroy Kor as well... I will help you stop him.
How will you traitors stop Typhon if you couldn't do what was necessary?
You're so focused on killing Typhon, you've lost sight of everything else.
I will bury you, turncoat.
Troops, flank the mad Halcyon.
I only want to save my people, Raider dreck. You are merely an obstacle.
We've hurt Halcyon's armies badly. He'll have to stay here and lick his wounds.
That means it's up to us to stop Typhon before he reaches the Nexus.
The Nexus is on the other side of the Razor Mountains.
Scanners are picking up caves that run through the mountain. We can move through those.
Careful...there is Xeno equipment everywhere.
The entrance has been sealed.
There was never any turning back anyway.
It looks like the Xeno are mining for something. I've never seen so many smelters.
We can't waste time here, Typhon gets closer to the Nexus every second.
I see light ahead! We need to move!
Katana, buy me some time. I'll set charges at the this exit and seal them in.
Typhon is ahead at the Nexus, but we have to cut around, the Blight is too thick leading up to it.
Righteous are all over our position.
They think we've been corrupted.
The Blightlands... it's so...
Overwhelming. The land itself hungers for flesh and blood.
Yurich! You've led the Imperials here? You trai-
Enough of the traitor talk. You're a threat to life itself, Typhon.
Ha, fool! I won't waste anymore time with you. The Bloodthirsty will annihilate you for me.
Where is the old man? Where is Halcyon? I wanted to watch him suffer and die!
The Prometheus Device has warped Typhon. He's going to try activating the Nexus again!
The Bloodthirsty ignore him...
Can you hear the Nexus? Hear it singing? So much power, so close!
We need to end this now, or Typhon will never stop!
Yes! Such power! Such strength! A new world will be born in my image!
The Nexus has unloc...
Katana! Katana, where are you?
Here... Yurich, look out behind you!
We are in Tartarus-
Yes, birthplace of the vile Bloodthirsty. The air itself corrupts life.
This place is the inverse of our world. We cannot allow you to become infected and join our enemy.
This whole place... it's as if the ground itself is moving.
We need to keep going. Whatever Typhon has planned, it isn't good.
Do you hear that buzzing?
Bloodthirsty are dropping out of the sky!
Raiders? Here? Why aren't they being attacked by Bloodthirsty?
Fields of bodies....as far as the eye can see. We need to leave this place-
They're moving!
Xeno!
What are they doing here?
They don't look right...
The traitor Katana and her dog, Yurich. Dispatch them quickly, Typhon is our goal.
Watch who you call a dog, you Imperial cur.
You're wasting precious time, lay down your arms, die and make this easier.
I'm not your enemy!
More of those strange Xeno!
They look like they have some sort of infection. There are sores all over them.
Halcyon didn't give you enough credit, this mission was supposed to be easy.
Wouldn't be the first time he was wrong!
Not since the Broodmother have I seen the Bloodthirsty act with such-
Intelligence.
We admire your endurance, but even the strongest succumb to the ravages of the Blight.
Aren't there more important things you could be doing than fighting us?
After we have dealt with you we will extinguish the heart of Tartarus once and for all.
The Raiders have established some sort of dig site. They are burrowing through those gigantic walls.
They're still loyal to Typhon Vex...
The ground is shaking.
Could be the drills.
No, it's too steady. Too rhythmic.
Bloodthirsty all around, but they are avoiding the Raider's completely!
Something is directing them. Keeping them away from the Raiders.
Raiders are flanking us!
Xeno, coming over the ridge!
Those sores are larger! Maybe the Blight is trying to infect them...
Lucina must've been through here. Raiders, killed by gunfire.
Careful! Bodies of fallen Raiders are splitting open and Bloodthirsty are crawling out!
Tenacious aren't we? You've come a long way to die.
I'm surprised the Blight hasn't turned you. No matter, I have won.
Die, traitor!
Commander Lucina, Typhon Vex-
He'll die right after you.
Yurich, watch your step. The ground is collapsing!
The Heart of Tartarus. The power of life itself...it's mine!
Ugh, what happened? Why is it so cold?
We're back in Arctis, and some friends followed.
How did we end up here?
Typhon merging with the core caused a powerful reaction. It killed most of our unit and knocked others out cold along with you.
Then portals began opening all over Tartarus. Those of us that remained grabbed who we could and jumped through. Unfortunately the Bloodthirsty followed.
I don't know what happened to Typhon though.
He remains trapped in Tartarus while he gathers power you send him. You must be perished.
We aren't giving Typhon power. We were trying to stop that madman.
Your intentions are irrelevant. To stop the Bloodthirsty resurrection, we must prevent the spread of the Blight.
Typhon, Blight, none of this makes sense.
Barracus has also escaped from Tartarus. He must know something, make him talk.
Why are you here Barracus? To follow us?
Ha! You always were short-sighted Yurich. Fine since you stopped me from completing my mission maybe you will do it for me.
The Righteous are summoning a Sentinel. It will eradicate all life on Acheron. No life, no Blight. It is the only way to stop Typhon, but you aren't willing to let everyone die are you?
Barracus is getting away.
We got bigger problems. Xeno scouts up ahead. They must have detected the energy signals from the portals.
So the traitor emerges. If you were hoping to harvest the Pantheon's energy to use against me don't bother. The Righteous have it heavily guarded.
Only you would devise a plan so foul. The Pantheon must be destroyed and I will take you out with it if I have to.
We've reached the Pantheon, but their defenses are as strong as Halcyon claimed.
The Bloodthirsty must be stopped. Your intervention endangers all of Acheron.
We'll find another way. Your barbaric ritual will end before it begins.
Thanks for clearing out that front line for us. We'll take it from here.
The Pantheon is charging up. The Sentinel will be here soon. Any idea how to stop it?
Blow it to Tartarus. Kill any that stand in our way.
Stopping the Pantheon now would be catastrophic. You are on a path that only leads to your doom.
I will not stand by and watch this world die. This ends now!
Once the Pantheon is destroyed we need to retreat. The reaction caused by its destruction could wipe us out.
Commander, we're on approach to the Worldship. Once we are in ran...
That'll have to wait. Some former comrades found their way on board before we launched. They are holding members of the crew hostage.
Caitalia, you seem as unpleasant as ever.
I get to kill the traitor as well as the Imperial meddlers!? Typhon will reward me greatly upon his triumphant return.
Katana, get down!
Nikolas, you broke free?
Hah! No Raider can hold me. We'll lead them to the rear of the ship. Once they're all trapped, we'll grab escape pods while you jettison the Raiders out the emergency hatch.
That's too risky. We need you.
You need to reach the Worldship. That is all that matters. Don't worry, our paths will cross again.
It's done. Good luck Nikolas. Consider your debt repaid.
Katana, Commander, we're approaching the Worldship. Get ready for a Xeno welcoming party.
Our first mission is to find as much information on the Worldship as possible. Design, purpose, where it's been, anything that can give us insight into the Xeno. Then we bring it down.
Yurich, stay behind and defend the ship. We'll need a quick getaway.
Hah! Relying on a Raider for your getaway, you've changed in the short time we've travelled together.
Only cause you know what I'll do to you if I catch you abandoning us.
We've found the room that houses the Worldship's database. Decrypting it now.
It's just as we suspected. The Xeno homed into the Blight as a beacon. Typhon's actions in Tartarus brought them here.
Katana, we're taking a lot of heat here.
I've almost decrypted everything. Commander, set the bomb.
Commander, wait! Don't set that bomb yet. We're taking it with us. Let's get back to the ship. I'll explain on the way.
We're ready to launch. Is she rigged to blow?
No, there is more to this vessel than we realized. The Worldship may prove valuable to us after all.
Want to explain to me why we left Worldship on its course of destruction?
The Worldship contains a weapon powerful enough to destroy the Nexus. If we can activate it, we can trap Typhon in Tartarus forever, but we'll need help and the Imperials aren't exactly trustworthy.
That leaves the Raiders. It is worth a shot, but we won't be welcome.
With Halcyon's constant attacks and their leader missing, I expected there to be more unrest. But the Raiders seem more organized than ever.
That is the result of Lord Silus. Always had his eye on Typhon's position. He may be insane, but he is quite a capable leader.
Yurich, you dare return here? Do you think we haven't learned of your treachery? And you bring with you the Imperial traitor. Do you think that can redeem you?
Save it, Silus. We both know you benefited from Typhon's departure, and no one on Acheron is happier to see him gone.
Hah! You may be right, but no leader can ever let a traitor return unpunished.
This can't honestly be your plan. There is no way this works.
No, he's wavering. I can break through to him.
Silus, Typhon is deranged and wants for nothing but destruction. Under your rule the Raiders can prosper and rise to wipe the Imperials from this planet.
I never thought I'd be in this position.
I would be lying if I said you weren't starting to intrigue me Yurich, but why do we need your help?
If you had a chance to stand against Typhon you would have taken it. We have a way.
Thanks for letting me know. I'll be sure to have my soldiers beat the information out of you before you succumb to your demise.
You'll have to do better than that if you want to take us out, Silus. Why don't you challenge us yourself?
Why should I bother?
Your pride wouldn't forgive you.
Very well. If you can defeat me in battle then you'll be worthy to earn my respect and the help of the Raiders.
Halcyon is a feeble old man! We need a stronger leader!
Do you think you can lead the Imperials? Can you make the hard decisions?
You're tired and your glory days are behind you. Step down graciously and spare this bloodshed.
There are larger threats than you out there. You need to learn your place.
There has been an increase in Bloodthirsty in this area.
Then Righteous will be here soon.
Possible blighted individuals. Purify.
These Righteous would kill every living thing to prevent any possibility of blight infection.
You will be cleansed by our divine weapons.
We finish this now.
Xeno have been spotted in this area working on some sort of satellite array.
We need to bring the array down or the Xeno will be able to signal their Worldship for reinforcements.
The Xeno have mobilized heavy units. They want to protect this thing at all costs.
Charges have been placed, Commander.
Then let's get clear before this structure comes crumbling down.

mission.name: Gore Typhon Enraged
mission.desc: Typhon refuses to go down. Defeat him again and escape Tartarus for good.

mission.name: Cyberius Recharged
mission.desc: Cyberius has regained power and has become stronger than ever. Power it down one last time!

mission.name: Excelsitus Emerged
mission.desc: Excelsitus has found his way to Acheron! Defeat him before he is able to summon his armada.

mission.name: Jotun Revitalized
mission.desc: Jotun has risen from his slumber once more. Put him to sleep for good.

mission.name: Halcyon Enraged
mission.desc: Halcyon has been driven mad by rage. Strike him down.

mission.name: GDR Rebooted
mission.desc: The GDR has been reactivated and is rampaging across Kor. Shut it down once and for all.

mission.name: Balefire Bolstered
mission.desc: Balefire has been reconstructed and is terrorizing the area. Put a stop to it once and for all.

mission.name: Vitriol Vile
mission.desc: The Vitriol from the pits has found its way to Kor and is causing Havoc. Stop it in its tracks!

mission.name: Mammon Mania
mission.desc: Mammon has crawled out from the cavern depths and is engulfing all that opposes it. Destroy it at once.

mission.name: Fissure Ferocious
mission.desc: Xeno engineers have rebuilt the Fissure. Dismantle it before it reopens the portal.

mission.name: Pantheon Powered
mission.desc: The Pantheon has been restored and is powering up. Take it down before it summons a Sentinel.

speech.line: Your insolence and feeble-minded actions here in Tartarus will not be tolerated.
Like its my fault!? The Righteous woke up that Bloodthirsty god with their silly crusade. I was the only one that saved your precious power!
You may have done well in some respects, and for that I am sparing your life. But you turned on me.
I was not in control. The fault in that lies in your hands.
Well so does your position in my empire.
If you demote me... I am gone.
So be it. Effective immediately you have been stripped of rank.
You're gonna regret this decision. I'm the best general you have!
You are the best general I had.

mission.name: Arachis Arrival
mission.desc: Arachis opened another portal to emerge from and reign terror over Acheron. Send this monster back from whence it came, and seal the Xeno beast away for good!

mission.name: Mighty Mephistopheles
mission.desc: Mephistopheles has found its way to the surface of Kor and is causing immense destruction. Annihilate it before it is too late.

mission.name: Paramount Patriarch
mission.desc: The Patriarch and his splinter cell of fanatic Righteous have reappeared from a temporal anomaly in the entrance to the Blightlands. Stop their purification or all life on Acheron will cease!

speech.line: This way! They'll never find us in here... What!? Who are you?
I'm a forgotten soldier. Exiled by his peers and doomed to a fate worse than death.
You look like an enemy to me!
Hush child, there is something strange about this man.
And what would you know about it old man?
I sense the blight is in you, but it hasn't taken control.
Should we kill him?
I'd like to see you try!
We do not need to shed your blood. I can offer you an alternative, for I have a gift bestowed upon me by the Sentinels.
What sort of alternative?
I can take the blight from you.
This explains why the council was willing to go through such great lengths to free you...
Do it. I don't want Typhon to have any hold over me when I seek out my revenge.
You will have to cooperate. This will still be painful for your mind. You must fight for your humanity.
I'm ready!
Lie down and close your eyes. See the blight in your mind's eye. With the power I am giving you, crush it!

mission.name: Fierce Fury
mission.desc: The Fury has awoken in the heart of Tartarus and has begun its venture out of the blight covered lands, seeking its Xeno masters. Stop its bloody march or all of Acheron will perish.

mission.name: Brimstone Beckons
mission.desc: The Brimstone was rebuilt by the Raiders after they escaped Kor. It serves as a mobile command center and is stationed just outside of Arctis. We need to destroy it!

mission.name: The Gateway Anomaly
mission.desc: Spacetime has been torn asunder in the Swamp Lands by The Gateway. Close the portal to stop the ancient Progenitors from flooding into Acheron!

mission.name: The Master Rises
mission.desc: An unimaginable power has risen from the depths of Acheron. Destruction is all that follows in its wake. This is truly the end for all.

mission.name: Barracus' Siege
mission.desc: Barracus appears in the Wasteland amidst the battles against the Xeno. He is a threat to the entire operation. Engage him!

mission.name: Razogoth Mutant
mission.desc: Razogoth has risen again as a horrible mutant. It is changing as it grows in power. This is a dangerous assignment Commander. We should make sure we are adequately prepared before taking on this monstrosity.

mission.name: Tyr Cannon Mutant
mission.desc: The Tyr Cannon is transforming into new and powerful mechs. This is a dangerous assignment Commander. We should make sure we are adequately prepared before taking on this monstrosity.

mission.name: Excelsitus Mutant
mission.desc: This is a dangerous assignment Commander. We should make sure we are adequately prepared before taking on this monstrosity.

mission.name: Albatross Mutant
mission.desc: This is a dangerous assignment Commander. We should make sure we are adequately prepared before taking on this monstrosity.

mission.name: Serapherus Mutant
mission.desc: This is a dangerous assignment Commander. We should make sure we are adequately prepared before taking on this monstrosity.

mission.name: Miasma Mutant
mission.desc: This is a dangerous assignment Commander. We should make sure we are adequately prepared before taking on this monstrosity.

mission.name: Protomech Mutant
mission.desc: This is a dangerous assignment Commander. We should make sure we are adequately prepared before taking on this monstrosity.

mission.name: Iron Mutant
mission.desc: This is a dangerous assignment Commander. We should make sure we are adequately prepared before taking on this monstrosity.

mission.name: Steel Mutant
mission.desc: This is a dangerous assignment Commander. We should make sure we are adequately prepared before taking on this monstrosity.

speech.line: Something is wrong...
What's the matter, little human? Scared?
No, Bloodthirsty can't speak, can't-
Think? Hahaha, oh little morsel. I will drink your marrow.
This is a nightmare! It has to be!
What is this....fog?! I can feel a dark presence but I cannot see a thing.
You have failed this world! I will devour you and it.
You're nothing but a nightmare, show me what you've got.
Foolish girl, you'll perish here...
Get back!
Haha, you're only delaying the inevitable.
I need to get out of here!
Start a final sweep- What in the seven hells is that thing?!
Tabitha, give me something on this walker.
Reports indicate Raider build, reinforced steel plate and three pilots. The Vegawalker.
Damn, there are Raiders all around that monstrosity. We'll have to take them down first.
Fire with everything you have, boys! Bring this thing down!
Sir, more reports are coming in of another Raider vehicle inbound.
Sir the Raider's hover tank has almost reached us.
Set up a perimeter!
Typhon must have ordered these Raiders to keep us distracted while he ran for the Nexus.
Where did these weapons come from?
They follow pre-fall Asphodel schematics. Typhon must have dug them up from the ruins in the wastes.
That thing is going to blow us apart if we don't flank it. Get in closer!
Don't let any Raiders break the line! We need keep this position.
We've got them where we want 'em. Focus fire on it's underside.
Sir, I'm reading increased energy levels from the walker and tank...
What's happening?!
The Vegawalker and the Tyr Cannon are fusing together! A mech that large will be unstoppable!
Try and keep in it's blindspots. Take out the Raiders around it so we can clear a path to this beast!
With each step that thing shakes the ground!
Stay down and move between rock formations. Hopefully we won't draw it's attention until we're on it.
Raiders were waiting for us! Fire!
The labs where these were constructed must be close. If we survive, we should look for them.
When we reach it, fire on it's exposed joints. It should be enough to damage it.
Focus fire and aim carefully. We only have one shot at taking Cyberius down.

mission.name: Excavation
mission.desc: Righteous soldiers swarm the excavation site. They intend to make you pay for disturbing them.

speech.line: Sir, is this really the best use of our time? Trudging through such harsh conditions.
Our neocyte supplies are low, and previous excavation teams have gone missing. This mission is of utmost importance.
I think I figured out why those other teams went missing. We are surrounded by Righteous.

mission.name: Dormant Enemies
mission.desc: There have been no reports of a Righteous invasion. They must have been here a long time.

speech.line: Clear them out! I don't want a single Righteous remaining.
Their bodies show signs of long exposure to the neocyte. They aren't here for it - they have been protecting it all this time.
They could be protecting something else...

mission.name: Search Continues
mission.desc: Octane and Tabitha traverse deeper into Arctis to discover the meaning of the Righteous presence.

speech.line: Shouldn't we get reinforcements?
The weather is jamming our communications, and we don't have time to wait for them. We finish this now.

mission.name: Sighting
mission.desc: Tabitha is able to glimpse the silhouette of a large structure in the distance, but another attack by the Righteous interrupts the scouting mission.

speech.line: That tower must be their point of origin if we take it we can scatter their remaining forces and pick them off.
How has a structure of that size been here without us knowing?
A massive beast is heading right for us. We need to get into position before it tramples us.

mission.name: Insurmountable
mission.desc: Take out the Righteous before the beast reaches you. Otherwise, their combined power will be insurmountable.

speech.line: I have heard stories. It is the ancient Righteous guardian, Serapherus.
You can tell me the stories after we kill it.

mission.name: Serapherus
mission.desc: The mighty Serapherus looms, with all three heads focused on you. Combined with the awakened Progenitors, this battle will be difficult.

speech.line: More Righteous come with it, wait that one is not Righteous. What is it?
Your careless actions have awoken the Progenitors, the ancient beings whose slumber we were sworn by oath to protect. The Pantheon's reactivation will be next...

mission.name: The Legend
mission.desc: You defeated Serapherus, but more dangers loom as the Pantheon gains more power.

speech.line: Is that tower what the Serapherus was guarding?
It has to be. Legend states Serapherus was guardian to the original Pantheon, the source of power for the Righteous and keeper of...
More Righteous. Is there an end to them?
So it is settled, we destroy the Pantheon.
Our scientists are reporting that the Righteous must have been inhabiting Arctis for hundreds of years. How is that possible?
Who knows? Probably has something to do with the Neocyte. I will bet anything that is what is actually powering the Pantheon.
This blizzard is getting heavier the closer we get.
We have dealt with worse conditions before.
We don't have enough charges to blow something of that size.
Then we will just keep firing until it comes down.
The Pantheon is powering up, we have to strike soon.
The Righteous are willing to die to protect the Pantheon. Let's oblige them.

mission.name: Pantheon
mission.desc: The Pantheon is fully charged, but its power is not only focused on the Righteous troops in front of it.

speech.line: The Pantheon is making the Righteous stronger than ever.
That's not all it is doing...

mission.name: Pantheon Fake
mission.desc: Pendin

speech.line: Pending

mission.name: Rise
mission.desc: The assault on the Pantheon was too late, it has summoned a force more powerful than you have ever seen.

speech.line: We did it! It is powering down.
No, it just finished what it was powering up for.

mission.name: Tremors
mission.desc: The ground shakes beneath Octane and Tabitha's feet, something large is about to emerge.

speech.line: Now what?
We have to find the source of the tremors, that is where it will emerge.

mission.name: First Sentinel
mission.desc: A monsterous figure emerges from the icy ground of Arctis with a destructive shockwave.

speech.line: Is that?
Jotun, the Sentinel born of the first Pantheon.
How do we defeat a Sentinel?
You don't you will be collateral in its destruction of the reawakened Progenitors.
Sir, Jotun may be powerful, but the main source of its power was the Pantheon, without it, it's crippled.
We have a chance, let's seize it!
Tell us how to defeat Jotun!
The Pantheon made it indestructible, but Jotun is still more powerful than your entire army.
This Righteous scum is useless, breakthrough him and get to the Jotun before he spreads his destruction to Ashrock.

mission.name: Jotun
mission.desc: Octane and Tabitha appear face to face with the towering Sentinel Jotun. It will take a miracle to overcome this goliath.

speech.line: This is our finest hour! Jotun does not break this line. Tonight we put a Sentinel back in the ground where it belongs.
Get ready...

mission.name: Xeno Atmosphere
mission.desc: Octane and Tabitha find themselves in the atmosphere of the Xeno homeworld. They hope to prevent a massive invasion and still get home alive.

speech.line: Are we certain the Xeno could not track our warp signature?
The Scion believes they may detect the warp, but not what was transported.
Then let's complete our mission quickly before they can report.
Alright Tabitha, lead the way.
We need to find the central command for this ship.
For a ship hovering over their own atmosphere it sure is well garrisoned.
Something's wrong... this ship is way over capacity for crew. These Xeno aren't even armed. They're not military - they're civilians.
So what is the plan when we reach the controls?
Seize control of th ship, and then we dock with the Worldship. We have to sabotage their warp systems to stop the invasion.
We're here. After we clear it out I will take over the controls and guide us to the Worldship.
Look at their homeworld! It is completely engulfed in Blight! All the civilians on board must be refugees...
The Enclave... their homeworld is gone? Is this the reason for their invasions?

mission.name: Rastax, Fleet Commander
mission.desc: Octane and Tabitha are discovered and must fight their way through or be lost forever in Xeno space.

speech.line: We've been scanned. The Enclave knows we're here!
What now?
Plan B... Attack Rastax, the fleet commander!

mission.name: Trivial Victory
mission.desc: After defeating Rastax, Octane and Tabitha become overwhelmed by the remaining Xeno forces and plummet to the Xeno homeworld in hopes of getting away.

speech.line: Rastax is defeated!
But the rest of the Xeno fleet is still firing at us.. We've taken too much damage already.
Setting a course for the Xeno homeworld. Hang on!
This was Plan B? Stranding ourselves on a planet deserted of all life besides ravishing Bloodthirsty?
We need to find a shuttle to escape the planet and commandeer another Xeno ship and continue our mission.
How are we supposed to find a shuttle amongst all this Bloodthirsty and Blight?
The Bloodthirsty are most likely concentrated by old Enclave habitations. That's also where the shuttles will be.

mission.name: Monstrosity
mission.desc: Though still a great distance away. Octane spots Razogoth, an ancient Bloodthirsty able to cover worlds with infectious Blight.

speech.line: That is the largest Bloodthirsty I have ever seen. It must be the height of a hundred Spires!
Razogoth lives... that's where we must go.
Not only are we marching into the largest force of Bloodthirsty we have ever faced, it is led by that monstrosity?
Would you prefer to huddle in a cave waiting to die?
We're here. What now?
There is no way for us to defeat Razogoth. We just need to distract it long enough to get a shuttle powered up.
I'll lead the attack on Razogoth. You work on getting us off this infected rock.

mission.name: Razogoth
mission.desc: Tabitha leads a small unit to find and get a Xeno pod operating while Halcyon leads the remaining Imperials to distract Razogoth from stopping Tabitha or destroying the shuttles.

speech.line: All units focus fire on Razogoth! Come on you maggots. You want to live forever?

mission.name: Narrow Escape
mission.desc: Tabitha and Octane made it off the Xeno Homeworld safely. Now they must continue their mission to prevent the Xeno invasion.

speech.line: Alright we're clear to launch, let's go Octane we don't have much time!
That was too close.
No time to rest. We're heading right back into the fray.
The Xeno will expect this shuttle to be filled with refugees. We'll take advantage of their surprise.
That was pleasantly easier this time around. Then again, anything is easy compared to getting off that deathtrap of a planet.
We got lucky. There were less civilians around to alert the command of our presence. We can't expect the rest of the way to be that easy.

mission.name: Stealthier Approach
mission.desc: Having comandeered a ship, Tabitha and Octane must make their way to Excelsitus to close the portals and prevent the Xeno invasion.

speech.line: We need to get as close to Excelsitus, High Admiral as possible without being spotted.
Excelsitus is responsible for powering all the portals. If we take it out they all shut down and the invasion will be halted.
So how are we supposed to get back?
We can program the ship to continue the assault after we go through the portal. We just need to do enough damage to weaken the hull.
Well, figuring out the timing for that should be a treat.
Looks like this is as close as we are getting, we've been discovered.
Hold them off. We have to get closer for weapons to lock on.

mission.name: Excelsitus, High Admiral
mission.desc: The mission comes down to this, if Tabitha and Octane leave to soon the invasion will go on unhindered. If they leave too late, well they will be stuck in space surrounded by homeless Xeno.

speech.line: That's it, all guns aim for Excelsitus. The Xeno invasion will end before it begins!

mission.name: Razogoth Reborn
mission.desc: The dreaded Razogoth has been reborn! Strike him down once and for all.

mission.name: Razogoth Fake
mission.desc: Pendin

speech.line: Pending

mission.name: Impending Launch
mission.desc: Halcyon and Aria are working on the finishing touches for the Phobos Orbital Cannon but are interrupted by the Red Maw leader Vargas, who plans to destroy the Spire before Phobos can be completed.

speech.line: We are drawing near to the final launch to complete the Phobos Orbital Cannon. Thank you Aria. If we didn't drag you away from the Red Maw we wouldn't have been successful.
It has been my pleasure Lord Halcyon. I'm proud to assist the glorious Imperials.
Halcyon! You've crossed the line for the last time. You'll pay for stealing my top weapons scientist for the purpose of enslaving my people.
Halcyon, allow me to fight alongside you. I want to bring that poor excuse for a leader to justice.
No, you must ensure the launch is successful otherwise Phobos will be incomplete.
Everything is prepped. The only thing I can do is help you buy time.
If you insist. Just don't get yourself killed. You're too valuable at this point.

mission.name: New Threat
mission.desc: The initial assault was just to draw Halcyon out. General Agmeus is the real threat.

speech.line: I leave you in the capable hands of General Agmeus. I must be off to prepare your other surprise.
Coward!
Let him run, protecting the Spire is our top priority.
Agmeus is a strong general but he is overaggressive. Use that to your advantage and you can defeat him easily.

mission.name: Surround
mission.desc: Halcyon and Aria's plan worked. General Agmeus advanced to an unfavorable position and has no idea he is about to be ambushed.

speech.line: Agmeus is moving into position. On my mark we surround him with full force.

mission.name: General Agmeus
mission.desc: General Agmeus may be at a disadvantage, but he is still a formidable opponent that will be difficult for Halcyon to bring down.

speech.line: I just got word on Vargas's position.
His time will come. For now, full assault on General Agmeus!

mission.name: Red Maw's Decline
mission.desc: Agmeus proved to be difficult to defeat but now Halcyon and Aria must take down the leader of the Red Maw to ensure the protection of the Phobos launch.

speech.line: Vargas is heading back to his lab. We have to cut him off.
He will expect that. Let him think we aren't pursuing and catch him off guard.
That could take too long. It is too risky to let him get back to his lab.
I am concerned about Vargas's threat. I hope Phobos is worth it.
Before I defected to pursue Phobos, I was assigned to Project Purger.

mission.name: A True Monster
mission.desc: Halcyon learns of Project Purger and now must redouble his efforts to hunt down and stop Vargas.

speech.line: What is Project Purger?
It's a walking death machine. It's capable of destroying anything in its path and protected with near impenetrable armor.
You left that project over a year ago. Could they have finished it without you?
We weren't close to finishing, but if he accelerated production, it's possible. We shouldn't take any chances.
Halcyon, how good of you to come to my doorstep. Now I don't have to go looking to kill you.

mission.name: Vargas
mission.desc: Although they have been discovered, Halcyon and Aria have gained a large advantage over Vargas... but Vargas still has his trump card to play.

speech.line: Surrender Vargas. There is no way out for you.
You may win this battle Halcyon but once the GDR5000 is powered up, your tyranny will come to an end.

mission.name: Cry Havoc
mission.desc: Vargas was defeated but there wasn't enough time to prevent the GDR-5000 from powering up. It is now creating havoc across Ashrock.

speech.line: It's massive! What is it?
GDR-5000. Or as I knew it, Project Purger.
It's heading for the Spire; it must be programmed to take it out and stop the Phobos launch.
I have a plan. It is risky but it may be the only way.
We don't have much choice. What is it?
If I can get close enough, I can plant an explosive that will disrupt the core and weaken it for a final confrontation.
Right then, I'll have one of my men...
No, it has to be me. We only get one shot at this and any mistake will cost us everything.
Alright I'm going in.
Come back in one piece. Alright men, all fire focus on the GDR-5000.
You did it! Aria, you're hurt.
It was worth it. I won't allow my creation to tarnish my honor as an Imperial. Imperials Forever!
Aria, NO!

mission.name: GDR-5000
mission.desc: Aria sacrificed herself to weaken the GDR-5000, now Halcyon must deliver the final blow.

speech.line: We will not let Aria's sacrifice be in vain. Everyone on me, for the Imperials!

mission.name: Hazy Memory
mission.desc: Alone and confused, Tabitha finds herself amongst an angry Righteous tribe and must fight her way out.

speech.line: How did I end up in the Swamp Lands. I can't even remember where I came from.
You are intruding on the ancient tribute. You will be expelled from this land.
I need to find Octane, but I can't let the Righteous get away. If they are summoning another Sentinel, they must be stopped.
We've stopped a Sentinel before and we'll do it again. Your efforts are worthless.
The power of the Sentinels pale in comparison to the power of the Divine one.
The Divine One?
It doesn't matter. Soon the Guardian will rise and put an end to your meddling.
This is getting out of hand. I need to finish this before I become overwhelmed.
That's enormous! It's bigger than a Sentinel.
Great Heimdal! Purge this land of the non-believers, so that we may prepare the tribute.
Use what you've learned Tabitha. Get into position and take it out.

mission.name: Heimdal
mission.desc: Heimdal is just a distraction compared to the power that is coming. But Tabitha must defeat it.

speech.line: I have a chance. This is my one shot to bring an end to this.
Preparations on the Carrier are complete to take us to the sacred ground. You will die here.
Tabitha, I finally found you.
Octane, where have you been? Do you know what is happening?
I can explain everything, but we need to get moving.
We originally separated during a battle. You were knocked out so I had the rest of your unit take you to safety.
Then these Fanatics showed up and wiped everyone out. I barely made it out alive.
What makes them different from any other Righteous?
They're outcasts because of their beliefs. Most Righteous worship the Pantheons and Sentinels. They worship something else entirely.
The Divine one, as they call it, won't just destroy all life on Acheron; it will destroy the planet.
That's insane! They will die with the planet.
Talking sense into them is not an option. We have to destroy them before they get to the ritual ground.
Your persistence is becoming tiresome. No matter, Evrane will destroy you as it brings us closer to achieving our salvation.
Evrane is their Carrier. It is said only those that arrive to the holy site on its back will be taken to salvation.
So if we destroy that we might be able to stop this before it begins!?
Resistance is futile, the tribute will begin soon.
We'll bring you down with Evrane!
Evrane has fallen.
We have been carried far enough to begin the ritual. Shiva will incinerate this world.
This is foolish. You will die with the planet!
Out of the ashes Shiva will rise carrying our corpses to a beautiful new world. Where upon we will be resurrected with immortality.
Told you it was no use. Take them out.
If they wish to lay down their lives then I say we take them.
A strange aura is blocking our shots. We cannot break through.
The time has come. You shall bear witness to the end.
We forfeit our lives so that you may rain your fury from the sky. We call on you now, Shiva!
It is coming from the sky.
Intercept it. We cannot let it reach the ground.
Octane, today we honor your many achievements. Your devotion to the Imperials is unquestioning and...
Lord Halcyon, we are being invaded.
The Raiders would dare attack on this day?
Not the Raiders sir.
It's massive.
It's a Worldship. It rivals planets in size and contains an armada large enough to occupy Acheron.
We need to commandeer one of the transports the Xeno are coming in on. It will take us to Wyrmhold.
Right, we won't get anywhere close to the Worldship without taking over one of the outposts it deployed.
Move Tabitha, we need to take this transport before it's gone for good.
We'll be facing heavy resistance, but once we control Wyrmhold we'll have an advantage.
Tabitha, status report.
We're approaching Wyrmhold.
We're being swarmed, take evasive action!
The controls are in the center. Once we're in we'll be able to start our assault on the Worldship.
That might have to wait. Looks like a Xeno fleet is coming to intercept us.
Halcyon, Wyrmhold has been secured.
Good, advance to the Worldship, we won't be able to hold the ground invasion much longer.
We got problems up here as well. Rastax has returned, and is on his way to intercept us.
I'll plot a course to avoid him and go straight for the Worldship.
There's no time for that. Fight through it.
He's right Tabitha. If we stray off course we may never make it to the Worldship.
It is too risky, we are out gunned.
Which is why they won't expect it.
Alright, I'll take us in. Octane prepare the main cannons. We'll need to reroute all power on my command.
A squadron of their fleet is advancing while another has broken out of formation. They are going to attempt to flank us.
They think we'll be defeated by such amateur tactics. Prepare to defend.
There's too many.
Punch through, we take out Rastax we can pick the rest off.
Almost there. Charge the cannons.
Waiting on your command. We can't get much closer.
All power to main cannons. Fire!
The rest of Rastax's forces appear to be clearing out.
I'm bringing up the schematics for the Worldship now.
Got it, looks like the Worldship has to stabilize itself in foreign atmospheres. We take out the stabilizer and the Worldship should come crashing down on its own.
The Stabilizer will be heavily guarded, what is our approach?
Only the exhaust will be heavily guarded. We will only encounter random patrols along the Stabilizer. We get past them and we can surprise the fleet stationed in front of the exhaust.
Be careful navigating near the Stabilizer. There is a reason it is not heavily guarded.
What is going on up there? We are getting beat back and you are going for a joy ride?
Either we do this right or we hand over Acheron to the Xeno. Tabitha Out.
He isn't going to like that.
Ha! I guess I'll just have to wait for my Honor Day.
We're getting close, prepare the assault.
Main cannons focus on the exhaust; secondary weapons keep the fleet off of us. We're bringing this Worldship down.
The remains of the Worldship belong to the Imperials. This is an incredible victory.
It looks like we were beaten to it.
How is that possible? We beat everyone else back.
The Bloodthirsty are enveloping everything. Nothing is salvageable.
It's beyond that. They are merging and mutating with it. We have to end this; Bloodthirsty infused with Xeno tech will be undefeatable.
They are coming at us from every angle. We need a plan.
There is a chance, the reactor is deep in the Worldship Core. If the Bloodthirsty haven't gotten to it we can trigger an explosion that will wipe them all out.
How can you be sure?
It was our backup plan if the Stabilizer didn't bring the Worldship down.
Wait, what was that?
The Kraken!? We must be near its nesting area and the mass of Bloodthirsty drew it over.
Tabitha, Octane come in. What is taking so long? We need those Xeno parts before the Raiders can regroup and form another offensive.
Situation is critical. Bloodthirsty have merged with everything from the Worldship. We cannot use any of it.
Abort the mission.
That will have to wait until after we have dealt with the Kraken.
You're lucky to be alive. Now get out of there and report back your findings.
Negative, if we don't deal with this threat now it will overrun Acheron.
You're in Kor territory; let the Raiders deal with the menace. We have more important things to worry about.
You cannot see what we see. There is nothing more important right now. You are a fool to think otherwise.
Your insubordination has cross...
Tabitha out.
Are you prepared to continue on?
It was a distraction I will deal with later. Right now my focus is on the mission.
The Bloodthirsty consumption is spreading too fast. We need to take out the source of the fervor, the Blightbloom.
We either need to attack from a distance or take it out fast. We won't last too long near the Blightbloom.
Well, we are short on time anyway...
Good, I was never one for the safe approach.
Hit it hard then fall back! The Bloodthirsty will be even more vicious near the Blightbloom.
We are near the core. We can end this.
But the Bloodthirsty are becoming more powerful.
Bloodthirsty are pouring into the remains of the Worldship trying to get to the core.
We need something to draw them off then. Most of our resources were used destroying the Blightbloom.
Is that what I think it is?
Rastax has been completely infested by Bloodthirsty!
This can work. Attack Rastax while I infiltrate the core.
As soon as Rastax is down clear the area. You don't want to risk getting caught in the explosion.
Come back safely Octane.
You as well.
Octane has been there for me as long as I can remember. I will not let him down.
I don't care how much more powerful you have gotten. This will be your end Rastax!
Lord Typhon, Imperials are attacking the bases bordering us. They are killing all in sight and burning them to the ground.
Is this your idea of a joke Yurich? Halcyon would not dare to siege Asphodel, we are near impenetrable.
Typhon, I implore you to see for yourself. Your people are dying.
How is this possible?
Halcyon will pay for this. Prepare our defenses. I will face this threat myself and draw that coward out.
We are getting reports that the attacks are being led by a massive mech.
The GDR-5000 rises again.
So Halcyon takes a machine built to bring death to his people and turned it against me. Does he think I will fall so easily?
Be ready to provide support Yurich. I'll face the giant head on.
Is that a good idea?
If I die here it will be protecting my people. Nothing else is more important.
Halcyon! As soon as I'm done with your giant metal puppet, I'm coming for you next.
I will put an end to Halcyon myself for his abhorrent actions.
It will have to wait. Reinforcements are heading directly for the capitol.
Have a unit lead an assault to give us time to intercept. We also need scouts to report what we are dealing with.
Incoming transmission from Halcyon.
Patch him through, we will see what the coward has to say for himself.
I implore you to surrender Typhon.
Asphodel has never fallen and will certainly not fall to the likes of you Halcyon.
I do not wish to spill the blood of your people. The Bloodthirsty will do that themselves if we cannot embrace the power of the Nexus.
Your greed would result in your abusing the power for your own ends. Enough of this; meet me on the battlefield if you find your courage.
Scout's report, the Imperials have loaded their siege APC - The Albatross - with enough troops to overrun Asphodel.
Halcyon thinks he has me beat, but he focused his entire force in one location. We take out the Albatross and we can swiftly end this invasion.
I will lead the assault on the Albatross. Yurich find out where that coward is hiding.
Typhon, the assault is being coordinated from a central point near the coast.
Intercept their signal and uncover their plans. I don't want anymore surprises.
Typhon this is your final chance. Lay down your arms and no more blood needs to be spilled.
You've become delusional. I've destroyed your death machine and laid waste to your reinforcements. You have nothing left.
You have no idea the capabilities that Balefire holds. It will bring you to a swift end.
Yurich, get all the information we have on the Balefire. No doubt Halcyon just spoiled his location and what is waiting for us.
Reports confirm that the Balefire is a Siege APC built to lead and coordinate invasions.
Yurich you have served me well. Stick with me through this final battle and I will show you how loyalty is rewarded.
Balefire is just over the horizon. Be careful, it doesn't look well guarded but it could be a trap.
Always the fool walking into my traps. Say goodbye to Asphodel.
You have gone too far Halcyon. Yurich, radio the armory to prepare the prototype mech.
I am Halcyon and in the name of the Imperials I urge you to surrender Asphodel to me.
The Imperials dare attack Asphodel?
Yurich, go and warn Typhon. I will hold off Halcyon.
Do you know who you are dealing with? I am the leader of the Imperials and the rightful ruler of all of Acheron.
Asphodel will remain free. It will never fall to the likes of you.
You cannot stop my forces. Give up Asphodel or watch it burn to the ground.
We shall see how your forces match up against us while I pilot the Asphodel Defender.
That puny excuse for a mech stands no chance.

mission.name: Asphodel Defender

speech.line: Show this Asphodel trash what happens to those that dare oppose the Imperials!

mission.desc: The Captain has taken the controls of the Asphodel Defender, which stands between you and Asphodel. Destroy it now!

speech.line: Halcyon, we have confirmed that Typhon is converging on the Balefire.
Excellent. We march for the gates of Asphodel.
Balefire will only hold out so long. We must move quickly before Typhon is able to reinforce Asphodel.
It won't be easy. The quickest route is blocked by the Gauntlet.
I have a plan to take down the Gauntlet and walk right in. Asphodel is as good as ours.
Halcyon, you were always too much of a coward to face me head on!
Your time is over Typhon. Asphodel and the Nexus belong to the Imperials.
The Gauntlet's firepower is unmatched when focused on a single point. But attack it from multiple angles and the wall will crumble.
Octane, attack the East side while I take down the West. We will march into Asphodel together.
Halcyon, they are blowing the bridge to prevent our crossing.
Everyone get clear!
What now?
It isn't over yet. We will enter Asphodel from the docks. Head for the coast.
Glad to see you haven't given up. I'll be waiting for you Halcyon.
We'll take Typhon head on. Nothing can stop us now.
You are in for a rude awakening. The Protomech is unmatched.
Typhon you bring about your own death. I can use the Nexus to free us all from the Bloodthirsty threat. Why can't you see that?
Your blind followers might believe your lies Halcyon but I no longer do. You are driven by greed just as you have always been.
It is no use Octane. I had wished to end this peacefully but it looks as if Typhon must go down to save Acheron.
We have been getting strange energy readings from this island.
Should be quick to investigate then. Let's get in and out.
Malika is leading Bloodthirsty?
Something is not right, but we cannot abandon this mission. We must be careful.
Xeno have joined their forces as well!?
Why is it called Alpha Island anyway?
An ancient story told of the first Progenitor that was so powerful it couldn't be destroyed. It was eventually sealed away below this island.
The island is guarded by Alpha's general Alexiares. Alexiares channels Alpha's power to take over the mind's of others and eventually turn them into Progenitors.
You mean like they just did with the Righteous?
Why haven't they taken over our minds?
I don't know. It is possible it takes time to penetrate one's mind. We have to find Alexiares and defeat him before it is too late.
That is the largest Progenitor I have ever seen.
It is nothing compared to what the rest of this island holds.
We've already lost some of our forces to that monster. Destroy it before we lose anymore.
Malika has been tracked to this island.
Why are we wasting our time with this?
Typhon needs her. He's been planning something big for awhile now.
Was that a Xeno leading...
This is the work of Progenitors. Malika may be in more trouble than we suspected.
This isn't worth it. Let's just report that she is dead. He can find someone to take her place.
I'm staying. There is more to this island than Malika and I want to find out what.
Well I can't have you turning up telling Typhon I abandoned the mission.
Barracus put the gun down. Think about it for a second. What if there is a secret power to this island that we can harness. Imagine the possibilities.
Ha, you know me too well Yurich. Probably too much for my own good.
What is that?
Anicetus. One of the guardians of the Progenitor Alpha.
This explains everything. The Progenitors are controlling everyone.
Well it's in my way of endless power!
More of them!
No. They aren't with the Progenitors. They could be okay.
They are still Imperials.
Raiders past the clearing, but they aren't acting like the other factions that were under control.
We have the drop on them. Take them out quickly.
Wait. They might just be able to help us.
Attack them now!
Imperials prepare to counter-attack!
What's that rumbling?
It's enormous.
Alpha has been reborn. I didn't think it was possible.
If you two can set aside your differences, we might just get out of this alive.
You expect me to work with Imperials? Disgraceful.
How can we trust the treacherous Raiders?
Yurich is right. What choice do we have?
Fine, but I'm keeping my eye on him.
Keep your eye on the enemy. I won't be coming to save you.
Come on Yurich. Let's show these Imperials how fighting is done.
We can't let the filthy Raiders outclass us. Alpha is ours!
Your reports are becoming increasingly concerning. Tabitha's insubordination is not just a threat to me but the safety of all Imperials.
I understand she has been out of line, but is this... What was that!?
Xeno ground forces have invaded Ashrock. They are heading straight for the Spire!
We have to evacuate the Spire and regroup. We stand no chance like this.
No! The Spire is too important to surrender to them.
If we die here we lose everything. We stand a chance if we live.
You are right. Send the retreat order. Evacuate the Spire.
It was as I feared, the Xeno are using the Spire as a power source. They are going to open a portal connecting our world with their homeworld.
The Xeno general Octix is behind this. He must be stopped before the portal opens.
Head for the Spire. I'll take care of Octix.
It won't help. We cannot get anywhere near the Spire while its powering up. We'll take down Octix together.
Is it over?
No, the Xeno will be channelling the power through a mobile source. We need to take that out.
We're getting concentrated power readings over this ridge.
Look alive. Xeno will bar our path along the way.
That glow is unmistakable. It is the portal tank, Fissure.
It must be finding the strongest connection to link to the Xeno homeworld. We must stop it. There is no telling what horrors lie on the other side of that portal.
I shall lead our armies to crush that tank and restore the Spire to its rightful owners.
Negative, we have to tread carefully. Destroying that tank could lead to a catastrophic release of all the energy it is storing.
We have to act now. There isn't much time.
You're right it is opening the portal. Destroy it now!
We were too late, the portal is opening and Arachis is emerging!
Maybe not. Arachis might not be able to fit through the portal. It seems we interrupted it.
If we can beat Arachis back we just may be able to seal the portal and save Acheron.
Our forces near the rift have been eliminated. We should regroup.
No. We need to press on and seal the portal before their armies outnumber ours.
Keep your troops in order Octane.
Face your fears or you they will be your downfall.
Don't give in to their mind games, we've got them moving back towards the portal.
The amount of Xeno in this area is insane. I will cut a bloody path straight through them.
We're almost at the eye of the storm.
Their forces are more concentrated the closer we get to the rift.
Well then the only choice we have is to go straight to the source and close the rift ourselves.
We must slay the Xeno beast. Seal the portal to end their stranglehold and stay their invasion of Acheron!
This area is forbidden, leave now.
There's Bloodthirsty in the area. We're hunting them down with or without your consent.
Very well, we won't stop you, but I warn you that there is a terrible danger within these Pits.
The Acid?
No some outcasts, the Forsaken, are attempting to build a weapon. We were sent to stop them.
Are those the Forsaken you mentioned?
Yes, they're weaponizing the Sulfuris Acid and love nothing more than to watch their victims melt.
Their crimes against humanity must be punished. They have to be stopped.
I agree. It seems for now we can move forward together against this threat.
I don't think I like this...
I think I know what happened to the Bloodthirsty... We've seen large skeletons emerging from the Pits.
There! The Vitriol that they stole from one of our encampments recently is between us and their Refinery.
Doesn't look like any of the Raider vehicles I've seen.
It is a prototype made to ride the Pits. The development was unfinished and it looks to have been greatly modified.
With that Vitriol out of way, we should set our sights on the refinery.
We're going to meet some strong opposition, it is sure to be heavily guarded.
These Forsaken... Why exactly were they cast out?
Their methods were too brutal and fiendish. They tortured and killed our own people. The Forsaken cast themselves out with their actions.
Raiders that are too brutal? I wouldn't have imagined such a thing existed.
It does when they are a threat to everyone, including their own people.
The Sulfuris is a powerful and cruel weapon. How could you let them colonize here?
When we cast them out into the Pits we did not expect them to survive, nor turn their hell into their salvation.
Should we really be helping the Raiders fight the Forsaken?
If their Sulfuris technology was able to dispatch those Bloodthirsty with such ease, I am afraid we have to.
We've made it, let's shut the Refinery down!
The refinery is down, we should push forward to their extraction site to cut off the Sulfuris supply.
I hope we can end this madness before their weapon is finished.
How exactly are they extracting it? What in the seven hells is that thing coming out of the Pit?
More stolen re-purposed technology, The Neurological Operating eXcavator, or N.O.X. for short.
Neurological? Why would an excavation tool need a brain?
The Sulfuris Pits are a dangerous place, excavation requires fast reflexes and thinking, something a simple mindless tool cannot provide.
Does that mean we have to worry about the N.O.X. fighting back when we shut it down?
It shouldn't, unless they tampered with it's programming I should be able to easily issue the shutdown command.
The Forsaken are coming straight at us! Though they don't seem to see us...
What is all this commotion? What are the Forsaken running from!?
The N.O.X. Status screen reads "Excavation target acquired. Deploying heavy ordinance." Its not accepting the shutdown command.
This is bad. This is very bad!
Damn! We are too late. They've finished their weapon!
That means we have to destroy it while we still have the chance.
The hulking machine is in the Forsaken's last foothold in the Sulfuris Pits. If we can root them out we should be able to put an end to their reign of terror on this land.
Then let us dispatch them with haste.
Can we not catch a break? These attack parties are slowing us down, we need to get to the weapon before it's launched.
Let them try to stop us, we'll render their warriors silent and put an end to their evil.
Their weapon does seem quite powerful. We may be able to take control of it and use it to hunt down all surviving Forsaken.
I do not think that to be wise; the weapon needs to be demolished. If you use it, how are you any better than they are?
This is not about being better, its about survival! You did not live in their terror. They need to be eradicated from existence, not just defeated. We can destroy the weapon after they are all dead.
You're mad!
I knew this was a terrible idea, you dare turn on us!?
Raiders, retreat! I will not forget this day, you can handle the weapon yourselves - but we will have our vengeance on the Forsaken.
The machine is attacking. Evasive maneuvers, strike back at its core and turn this hunk of metal into scrap!
Ugh... That was a rough fall. Where in the Seven Hells are we?
Sir! I think we found the Bloodthirsty we were tracking.
Fighting the Forsaken woke something up down here. It caused a collapse and made us fall.
Well we're in the thick of it now! We need to slice our way out of here.
Looks to me that some of the Forsaken we were fighting survived the fall, but they did not survive the Bloodthirsty.
I wonder if Yurich and the Raiders got away before the collapse?
Let's not concern ourselves with those that betray us.
Any plans on how to get out of here?
By climbing the corpses of our foes.
Our dead bodies would join our foes in that corpse pile if we tried to fight that long.
That far cavern wall looks like it might be scalable... but we're going to have to deal with that monstrosity in front of us first.
Speaking of which... what exactly is this thing we're approaching? I cannot tell where the teeth end and the mouth begins.
By the look of it, I would venture a guess that these are not the Bloodthirsty we tracked here... it looks like it lives here.
A Bloodthirsty colony under the Sulfuris Acid Pits? I guess they'll be tough to kill... I love a challenge!
There's not enough teeth in this cavern to kill me.
The amount of Bloodthirsty keeps increasing... Over there! That cave sort of looks like an exit.
Are we sure there are exits? I still think scaling that far off wall would be better.
I'd rather not risk our lives rock climbing with Bloodthirsty nipping at our heels.
Well well, if it isn't our friends the Imperials.
I had hoped I wouldn't have to see your face again any time soon Yurich.
I realize I was being no better than the Forsaken. You were right, destroying the weapon should have been enough.
I don't think we have time for your apology.
Honestly, I wouldn't mind leaving you here to meet your end by the tentacles in this cavern.
We can work together and get out alive, or split up and make this cavern our permanent home. Don't be a fool.
Very well, we'll lead you to safety as soon as we figure out where safety is... but I have my eye on you.
So what exactly is the plan?
We're going to try seeing if there is an exit in that glowing red cave.
You mean that ominous glowing blood red cave behind a gigantic Bloodthirsty? Are you insane?
We don't have much of a choice!
More Bloodthirsty to conquer. I care not how large the beast, only more for me to slay!
Well this cave is a bust. All we did was wake up more Bloodthirsty!
Pretty big ones at that!
Does this mean we have found our graves?
Not quite. On the other side of that giant snake-looking monstrosity is a wall that looks like it can be scaled.
Getting to where we could even think about scaling that wall would require quite the boost up… how exactly do you plan on doing that?
Remember what I said about climbing the corpses of our enemies?
I did not think you were serious.
That Bloodthirsty looks like it has enough mass to get us where we need to go provided we kill it first.
Why do Octane's plans always include getting into the biggest fight possible?
The hard fights are the fights that end up mattering in your life Yurich.
We're almost to the end of this nightmare… If we make it out alive we're going to reek of Bloodthirsty entrails for weeks.
A fitting trophy considering they want us inside their entrails.
Watch out! This creature seems to be controlling the other Bloodthirsty.
Domino effect, kill the leader and the rest will follow - this is our way out, don't hold back!
Do as you are commanded!
No, this mission is against everything I stand for.
You will comply or you will be stripped of rank and sentenced to death.
Very well, old man. I am not your puppet and will not do your dirty work for you.
All units in the area, this is not a drill. Tabitha has betrayed us. I want her brought in dead or alive.
Fellow Imperials! You're blind to his ways comrades, think for yourselves.
Do not listen to her pleas to convert you. You are all subjects of the Imperial Army, unlike this back stabbing traitor.
It is not I that has stabbed anyone in the back, Halcyon. This "mission" you want me to do is nothing but betrayal to our allies in their time of need. A role I will not partake.
It is for the good of our people and the vision of our goals. Your small minded view of the world will be your undoing.
I will fight for what is right regardless of what the implications are. You cannot quell justice with your atrocious acts of war.
You will be silenced. Attention Cain's Outpost! See that Tabitha and her supporters meet their end.
Imperial Dark Ops touching down in Valhalla Station. Preparing to engage the threat.
Good, keep me updated on your progress. The enemy has gotten far enough past friendly lines.
Octane, Stop this madness!
What is the meaning of this? Tabitha, why are you with enemy forces?
Do not let her distract you, she is leading these traitors.
I am no traitor!
Tabitha... If you've turned your back on the Imperials, then you have to be a traitor.
But I have not turned my back on the Imperials, only on Halcyon.
I am the Imperials! You are nothing but whelps without me.
You dare to say you are Imperial when you operate in the shadows and use assassination plots against our allies!?
Sir. Engaging Tabitha's forces. I am going to apprehend her.
Kill her! Her fate has already been sealed. Send her to the Seven Hells where she belongs.
Octane, I won't hesitate if you are going to follow his lies. Do what you know is right!
Halcyon, I will not kill her.
You forget your place. If you aid the traitors then you share their fate.
I would like to see you try to stop us. I've slain every foe that has ever dared cross me.
We need to get out of Valhalla Station. Retreat now, we can threaten Halcyon later.
We're not going to be able to escape with The Intrepid on our tails. We're going to have to make a stand.
Very well, we'll destroy The Intrepid and then escape through the valley.
You are not wise if you think you can escape my grasp. This ship is the strongest in my fleet.
We may not be able to match its power, but our strategy is greater and we are on the side of justice.
These traitors are more foolish than I could have imagined. Helmsman, bring us forth and prepare to fire on the port bow!
Here it comes... I hope we live through this.
We will rain fire on Valhalla from the heavens, and if worst comes to worst... it is a good day to die!
We're still on the trail of the Righteous... what would they be doing here?
Isn't this island where we encountered the Progenitors last? I had hoped we wouldn't ever have to return.
I'm intercepting a transmission nearby.
Sir! We have encountered a deployment of Imperials on the island.
Dispatch them quickly. We cannot let them interfere with our operations.
These Righteous are... up to something. Something big.
The Imperials are crushing us. Request Heimdar loadout.
Very well. I have commanded Heimdar to aid you.
What's a Heimdar?
One of the 12 Gatekeepers of the Righteous Holy Order. The colossus that stands before us.
Engaging the enemy on retreat. Heimdar is descending upon them.
That thing is attacking, watch out.
Get out of my way you Righteous hunk of junk!
Sir, I have grim news. The Imperials have bested Heimdar.
Continue your retreat and wait for air support. We must ready the Olympus Fragment before the Imperials stop us.
Olympus Fragment? What is that all about?
It could be Progenitor technology given our location... but I honestly don't know.
My transmission receiver seems to be malfunctioning... There's a signal forcing its way through!
Imperials. Turn back now. If you venture further into the island we will cleanse your people from history.
What's that? You want a fight?
Your aggression lacks divine order. We will restore order to the universe.
History? Universe? It sounds like the Olympus Fragment may be very powerful.
A power that no man should be able to wield if they aren't lying.
We are not men, we are gods!
The Righteous aren't well known liars...
Then it's an actual problem. We'll have to stop them!
Dactyl, protect Antalya and stop these cretins from disrupting the cleansing.
We don't have time for this! We need to get to the Patriarch and stop this madness.
Nothing can beat us Tabitha. There's no power in time or space that can stop me!
We've slain the Dactyl, but I fear we may be too late to stop them.
Nonsense, we keep marching!
All forces, stop the Imperials in their tracks. The Olympus Fragment has activated and we're almost to the promised land.
We're doing our best to resist them sir, but they are breaking through our ranks.
And we're not going to stop!
We've got them against the ropes.
No foe is a match for me... least of all you Righteous fools!
No, no, no. Kill them! We just need to make some final adjustments to slay the Bloodthirsty. We can end all of our enemies. Perfect order must be achieved!
All Righteous form on the Olympus Fragment. We are the last line of defense to ensure our goals are met.
Fellow Righteous, your sacrifices will not be in vain, for in the new order you will be kings and our enemies will have never existed.
Protect the Olympus Fragment, it is our salvation!
More zealots to slay.
You are too late! Witness the divine power of order and stay your feet.
Ugh! This power is overflowing from the island... we have to stop it.
Full force. Destroy the Progenitor structure and end this madness!
Where... Where are we? We were trying to destroy that Progenitor structure then...
Everything got blindingly bright. Blew out the sensor in my eye.
This looks like Ashrock... but that spire in the distance is not the spire I remember.
We're being attacked by Bloodthirsty!
It seems its more than Bloodthirsty. We're also surrounded by Xeno! And Raiders! And Righteous... and Imperials... Something is very off.
They're all emitting a strange green glow.
Arghhh!
What's wrong?
My ears are ringing. Ugh... it stopped. We need to get out of here.
Large Bloodthirsty incoming!
It looks oddly familiar...
Didn't we kill this thing when we escaped from the Cavern of Blood?
If we killed it once, we can kill it again!
That kill felt more satisfying the second time around... hope we can fight it again some day.
I would rather not fight that thing again.
It looks like the glow is emitting from the Spire as well. Maybe we can stop these attackers if we shut the Spire down?
You want to ruin all the fun of crushing all these foes?
There's plenty of foes to crush on the way there. We can't fight forever.
This headache is killing me... What the heck is this thing in the way of the Spire?
More foes to crush. I could fight forever!
I think it's Imperial technology, but what is it doing here?
I suspect there is something bigger going on here than we realize.
It looks like a GDR-5000... but its different. Same green glow as the others.
It looks like scrap metal to me!
Alright we beat... it... now... ugh... I...
Tabitha? What's wrong?
Octane... kill... me...
No I cannot. I've sworn to protect you!
You are a fool to challenge us. But you are interesting... why are you not affected by Mesmerize's power of control?
Leave her alone! I swear I will crush you and everything you've ever loved if you do not free her.
How long do you think you can fight us without killing her? Without her killing you?
Nothing strikes fear into my heart. I will end your power over her by destroying your toys.
Destroying the Spire will only make us pause. Mesmerize's power exceeds all bounds.
No mortal can destroy Mesmerize. We will control all. All will be one.
You assume I'm only human. No one will ever control me!
Asphodel... No...
Drastic times call for drastic measures Typhon. The Nexus belongs to the Imperials.
You are a fool Halcyon. The Nexus's powers vastly exceed your pitiful comprehension.
Am I the one fleeing from battle right now? Who's the fool Typhon?
I may be down... but I am not out. The bodies you have buried this day will be avenged. Asphodelians! Make way to the tunnel system.
You cannot escape us! Lay down your arms and surrender.
Halcyon, you seem to forget that you're still in my territory. I still have some advantage. Aileron! Cover our escape.
Delaying the inevitable once again I see. Imperials, blast this Aileron out of the sky!
We've got to keep moving, the Imperials are gaining on us!
Quit while you still can Asphodelians. Your city is in ruin, your lands desolate. Accept your fate and surrender yourselves.
We will never give up! We will never surrender!
Typhon, I know how you must feel, but there is no honor in running. Kneel before your conquerors.
We won't run forever. In fact we're not running anymore. Asphodelians, about face! Ready the Protomech!
More aggression instead of seeking mercy? Typical. This move smells of desperation.
It is a trap that I have laid for you, that you walked directly into. You are a worthless tactician.
Your Protomech has not stopped us before, it won't stop us now. Stay your feet and accept defeat!
RES-Omega, please check in.
Copy my liege.
Confirm that Bloodthirsty activity in the area has ceased.
Can confirm that the area has been cleansed. Blight activity is non-existent in the ruins.
Excellent. Your squad may return to the Citadel.
Hold on... There seems to be a surge of activity nearby... It's Xeno!
The Xeno returning to their ruins... and only now that the Bloodthirsty are gone. Interesting.
Orders sir?
See what you can glean from their activities, but stay hidden.
We have been encountering heavy hostile forces, but I do not think we've set off their alarms yet.
If they are there for something important there should be at least a Class 4 Xeno. Do you see anything matching that description?
There is a large Xeno in the water... should we engage?
No. Wait until they have found what they are looking for then report back to me.
I'm sorry sir, that doesn't seem to be possible, the Class 4 Xeno has detected us.
Very well. Cease their operation, those ruins are ours now.
It seems to have found what it was looking for in the struggle.
What do you mean? Report!
A Class 5 Xeno has descended from the sky. The area is swarming with Xeno activity!
Request backup!
Request denied. You know the rules, until the quarantine has been lifted I cannot send our people to an area that may be unclean.
But my liege, I have already confirmed that the Blight has been cleared.
As well as that may be, there is obviously something afoot. Get out on your own. Those that fall behind stay behind.
Most of their resources seem to be focusing on excavating something from the ruins. We'll use this opportunity to evacuate.
Rescind previous order and stay your feet. If you're able to recover whatever they are there for it would shine brightly on your future in the eyes of the Elder Council.
If we remain it would be suicide!
I have faith in your abilities. Have faith in yourselves. Find what they are looking for and take it for the greater good of our people.
Hrmmm... Yes, my liege.
The excavation drones are concentrated on the island. Their goal must be there!
Recommend disabling the drones before attempting extraction.
By the Glory of Talos, we will bring them down!
Righteous caravan spotted. They seem to be launching an assault on Tartarus in this sector just as you expected.
