Do not let them through. The Blight is our power, our edge, against our enemies.
Stop, Righteous scum! You should not have stepped foot in Tartarus.
You are misguided. The Bloodthirsty must be cleansed from our world.
Leave or I will put a bullet in that pretty skull of yours.
Then shoot. We're not leaving without completing our mission!
My pleasure.
Stop toying around. Kill them!
Get off my back. I'm running this operation.
You should know better than to disobey me.
Hrrnnghhh!...Yes, sir.
The caravan's advance is nearing the bridge. We will ambush them there. Looks like they've brought some powerful units.
I will not accept any excuses. Do not let them get into the heart of Tartarus.
Stand aside, Raider!
You think your worthless mechs can tangle with me? I will crush you!
I managed to stop their frontal assault, but they've brought in a flying transport carrying what looks like... some sort of Xeno bomb.
So that is their plan? Very well. Shoot it down, but see that you don't set the bomb off.
You want me to fire on a potential explosive?!
See to it how you will, but if that device reaches the heart it will be the least of your worries.
Your plans are always crap. I'll board their transport from the bridge.
Fine. Careful not to die, I wouldn't want to have to come deal with the problem myself.
Core Carrier, your path is clear. Engage and move toward the target.
Look at these adorable Righteous coming to play with the big boys. Looks like I'm going to have to take out the trash.
Evade their defenses. Deploy the Class 7 Core!
Like hell you will!
What is the situation?
Boarding the enemy transport! I will tear them out of the sky.
Report. I need your report soldier. Barracus... can you hear me?
An explosion... the Deidon is down, but the Bloodthirsty are going insane.
I am losing my grip over them...
I need to get out of here!
Some Righteous made it out alive, but there are plenty left that are being converted by the Blight.
Do you see any large Bloodthirsty in the area? Something is blocking my control.
In the gorge below there's a very large one. Do you think that it could be the cause?
It must be. Slay the beast so I can regain control of the Bloodthirsty or you will surely perish in Tartarus.
Another disgusting Bloodthirsty monstrosity. I'd kill it for fun!
I feel some strength returning to me, but the Bloodthirsty are still not obeying my command... I am coming over there.
I... I can't... I... Ugh...
What's the problem? You're breaking up.
I SEE YOU...
Barracus?
NO. THIS VESSEL HAS BEEN TOUCHED BY THE BLIGHT AND IS WITHIN MY GRASP. I AM KALIHMAH.
Barracus, snap out of it. You answer to me!
THERE IS NO BARRACUS. LEAVE MY CHILDREN ALONE. YOU HAVE CORRUPTED THEIR PERFECTION.
I will rip you apart! You cannot take my power from me!
THIS POWER WAS NOT MEANT FOR YOU.
GO, MY CHILDREN. CONSUME THIS HERETIC WHERE HE STANDS.
I am the supreme ruler of Tartarus and high king of the Raiders. No filthy beast such as this stands a chance!
Arctis HyperSec Prison is in view. Moving in to secure the package.
May your sword be guided by the wisdom of the Sentinels. Your mission is of utmost importance.
There seems to be a weak amount of resistance in the area. I haven't set off any alarms yet, but it seems some of our intel was either faulty or outdated.
Resistance or not, you need to get Emrys now. The timing is not forg... iving, we only... ha... ve... one... ch... ance.
You're breaking up. Damn this blasted mountain!
Emrys! I'm here to rescue you.
We're going to have a rough time getting out of here. The alarm has been tripped.
Alarm or not, we need you out of here. Hold on!
We must be on the move. We don't want to be caught by the Steel Sheriff.
We'll escape through the pass. Go, go, go!
Sound all the alarms! Report to Halcyon. We're hunting them down now.
Elder Constantine, come in. The package is secured but extraction is not going as smoothly as planned. Sir? Do you read me?
The alarm systems emit transmission blocking frequencies. We're never going to be able to contact the Order while we are still near the prison.
Emrys, cease and desist. If you do not turn yourself in we will authorize lethal force.
They're tracking us... I don't know how.
An implant. They tag everyone that is admitted into HyperSec.
Well we're going to have to remove that. Where is it?
My heart.
How are we supposed to remove it!?
It would take a very skilled surgeon. However I think that this is the least of our problems right now.
Why do you say that?
They have found us.
S.S. you have my authorization to terminate the target with extreme prejudice.
SURRENDER OR DIE.
I choose death!
You know Octane, I never thanked you for saving my life. Thanks.
Think nothing of it. I expect you would have done the same given the circumstances.
I am tired of fighting through these hordes of Progenitors though. What do we need to do to get out of here already?
Tired of fighting?! Ha. I will take on your share. I will fight to the end of time if I have to.
Maybe if we can find a device similar to what brought us here in the first place?
Or if we can kill whatever that thing that mind controlled you before? I like the killing plan more.
But look out there. Do you see that big glowing structure in the distance?
Yes. It looks somewhat familiar... what could it be?
I think we should investigate. It could be our ticket home.
Well we're going to have to fight through a bunch of Progenitor scum on the way. I like it!
Speaking of Progenitor scum.
This thing is huge.
Stand back, I'll take care of it!
Great. You always have to show off. Now the jungle is swarming with Progenitors.
Hey! You can't blame me for carrying out my basic instincts. Besides, there's more slaying to be done now!
Ugh, can we please make our way towards the structure?
Hang on, there's a monster of a Progenitor over there. We really shouldn't turn our backs to it.
Next time I decide to get lost in an alternate dimension with someone, I am going to try and make sure they are the stealthy type.
Stealth is for cowards. Come on, let's take it out!
Well it sees us now. That's for sure. Incoming!
I'll beat it to death with its own tentacles!
Well at least you scared it off.
Come back here Progenitor! Don't you want your arm back? Ha ha!
When we get back, you should probably seek some sort of counselling.
You are just jealous of my prowess in battle.
Sure. Anyway, can we get back to what we were doing please?
We're almost to the entrance of the structure. Very interesting looking.
We must tread softly. I don't know what this thing is or does. If it's a weapon we'll want to be able to escape it at a moment's notice.
Tread softly? If it's a weapon we'll destroy it. Pay no heed to danger, shoot first and ask questions later.
Well it seems there's some sort of security system in place... and you've set it off.
Good! I was getting bored without a challenge. Give me your best shot you hunk of scrap!
I do not want your insolent excuses. I want you to find them! Bring me their heads!
Apologies my liege. Their trail went cold at Alpha Island.
Those two traitorous dogs think they can just turn their backs on the Imperial regime.
Sir... I just received an urgent report.
Out with it!
There seem to be some intruders at Valhalla Station.
They are Righteous, sir.
Those fanatics are crossing a line by stepping foot here. We will destroy them. Send a message that no one can infiltrate our bases and live.
I'm reading a large mass of energy at the base. They have an Armament!
Your orders, sir?
They will not stand up to Imperial technology. I will destroy it personally.
Stay your hand Halcyon, this station is now forfeit!
Like hell it is.
How exactly does one of Typhon's dogs get to fighting for the Righteous anyway?
You do not know what you are talking about. Don't ask questions you don't want the answers to, old man.
Ha! Well you can pack up your toys and leave. If you are quick, I might not put a bullet in the back of your head.
You couldn't hit me if the barrel of your gun was against my chest.
Emrys! Through the base, you'll find what you're looking for on the other side. I'm going to hold these Imperial losers back. Do what you need, but do it fast!
What exactly are you getting at? Nikolas, follow them. Find whatever it is they are doing and stop them.
Aye sir!
You should have turned tail and ran while you had the chance, old man.
Strong words for someone intruding on my land. Bow down to me and I will make your death swift.
Ugh...
Time to die.
Halcyon! Come quick!
Hmph. Stay dog.
Report!
This Righteous sir... he's amassing a great amount of power at the peak!
Stand down, you can not stop the Ascension.
Aside, cur! Or did you not witness the beating I gave poor little Barracus?
No matter, I will stand between you and the Ascension if it's the last thing I do.
Then it will be the last thing you do!
Argh!
Unlike your master, I will finish what I started.
Nikolas... No!
Emrys! I need your aid.
You killed Nikolas! I will show no mercy upon all of you filthy Righteous!
The Ascension is complete. The power of the Sentinels flows through me. Bow down to me, foolish mortal.

mission.name: Intrepid In Space!
mission.desc: Fight through the near endless forcefields to stop the Imperials from taking down the Worldship!

speech.line: It has been a long time since I have seen the green glow of this dire place.
So why exactly are we here?
Were you not briefed? There has been a lot of activity in the area. We're not sure if it's the Forsaken back at it or something worse.
Well... from the looks of things, I am going to guess it is something worse.
The Bloodthirsty!? I thought they might have died when we escaped the caverns.
You mean you've seen these Bloodthirsty before?
It's a long story. These Bloodthirsty are especially dangerous. Born and bred in the Sulfuris itself, deep underneath these lands.
So we should leave then?
No, we have a mission to complete. If the activity is considered hostile, we are to terminate it. I consider these Bloodthirsty very hostile.
They're swarming all over the Refinery. If we can take that, we may be able to use the Sulfuris to our advantage.
Sir, I don't think they are swarming all over the Refinery. I think the Refinery is a Bloodthirsty!
Seven Hells!
It's huge. How are we supposed to kill this monstrosity?
At least it is not very mobile. Dodge its attacks and strike back!
That was a bloody mess.
There's more Bloodthirsty emerging from the pits!
Off in the distance, there is a gigantic flying beast.
One step at a time. We're surrounded!
Cut a path through here. I've got your back!
We really should be using a larger force.
Resources are spread thin. We'll make do with what we have.
Since we're going to be here a while, how about you tell me that long story?
It's not something I am proud of.
Come on. If we're to die, I do not want to die curious.
I worked with some Imperials here before. We fell into the cavern below. I had to beg for mercy.
If the Imperials had not forgave me for attempting to steal the Forsaken technology... I might have died.
We'd all do the same if it meant saving our skins.
It's more than that. Those two Imperials seemed different than their brethren. Much how we are different from ours.
No time to get sentimental. The beast approaches.
Let's ground this monster!
Another beast slain. Here I thought we might actually have a challenge!
What's that sound?
The earth is quaking beneath us. All the Bloodthirsty are going insane!
Seven hells.
That is a rather large foe.
I thought we killed it...
What are you talking about?
Before, we faced off with this monster in the caverns below and scaled its corpse to escape.
Well it seems alive and well to me.
We'll have to change that.
If Octane could slay this beast with such finesse, I am sure that we can finish the job properly this time.
Watch out! It's attacking!
Reporting for duty sir.
At ease. We've got a situation here in the Wasteland.
There have been reports of Xeno activity. Our mission is to cease their operations, and if possible claim any of their technology.
Stealing from the invaders seems like a suicide mission.
Only if they know we've stolen from them. We've got a new machine that is jamming their comms. They are effectively in the dark.
What about escapees?
Dead Xeno tell no tales.
As you wish, sir. We'll eliminate all hostiles.
There is the general. If we can take him out, we might be able to send their troops into disarray and defeat them swiftly.
There's only one way to find out. Here it comes!
Blast! He got away.
Tracking his movements.
Looks like he's headed for the Nexus?
Hold on... looks like we have bigger fish to fry.
Some sort of drone dispatcher... they're trying to make contact outside the atmosphere!
Shoot them down, I want everyone to focus fire on the drones. We need to head for the Xeno releasing them.
Raiders! Fire at will! If you let a single drone escape the entire operation will be thrown into jeopardy.
Approaching the beast emitting the drones now.
The drones... they've changed course. They're congregating around the Nexus!
Ignore them for now. We need to shut this thing down!
The Xeno has stopped emitting drones, but is evading us.
Sir... The Nexus.
Arachis!? How?
The Xeno at the Nexus pulled it through the portal!
The portal to Tartarus?
We don't have time to ask questions. If we don't stop that thing, the Nexus will be destroyed.
It would also make for a great bounty.
You want us to appropriate that thing!?
The bigger the Xeno, the better the technology.
We need to focus our efforts and make a coordinated assault.
I am not sure we have time to coordinate. Arachis has noticed us!

star_type.desc: Defeat the Mission in X turns or less.

star_type.name: Cards in Deck
star_type.desc: Defeat the Mission with X or less cards in your deck, besides your Commander.

star_type.name: Damage Received
star_type.desc: Defeat the Mission with X damage or less dealt to your Commander.

star_type.name: Card Casualties
star_type.desc: Defeat the Mission with X Cards or less being destroyed.
